00049 /**
00050  * Represents a single Ruby on Rails or Rack application instance.
00051  *
00052  * @ingroup Support
00053  */
00054 class Application {
00055 public:
00056         class Session;
00057         /** Convenient alias for Session smart pointer. */
00058         typedef shared_ptr<Session> SessionPtr;
00059         
00060         /**
00061          * Represents the life time of a single request/response pair of a
00062          * Ruby on Rails or Rack application.
00063          *
00064          * Session is used to forward a single HTTP request to a Ruby on Rails/Rack
00065          * application. A Session has two communication channels: one for reading data
00066          * from the application, and one for writing data to the application.
00067          *
00068          * In general, a session object is to be used in the following manner:
00069          *
00070          *  -# Convert the HTTP request headers into a string, as expected by sendHeaders().
00071          *     Then send that string by calling sendHeaders().
00072          *  -# In case of a POST of PUT request, send the HTTP request body by calling
00073          *     sendBodyBlock(), possibly multiple times.
00074          *  -# Shutdown the writer channel since you're now done sending data.
00075          *  -# The HTTP response can now be read through the reader channel (getStream()).
00076          *  -# When the HTTP response has been read, the session must be closed.
00077          *     This is done by destroying the Session object.
00078          *
00079          * A usage example is shown in Application::connect(). 
00080          */
00081         class Session {
00082         public:
00083                 /**
00084                  * Implementing classes might throw arbitrary exceptions.
00085                  */
00086                 virtual ~Session() {}
00087                 
00088                 /**
00089                  * Send HTTP request headers to the application. The HTTP headers must be
00090                  * converted into CGI headers, and then encoded into a string that matches this grammar:
00091                  *
00092                    @verbatim
00093                    headers ::= header*
00094                    header ::= name NUL value NUL
00095                    name ::= notnull+
00096                    value ::= notnull+
00097                    notnull ::= "\x01" | "\x02" | "\x02" | ... | "\xFF"
00098                    NUL = "\x00"
00099                    @endverbatim
00100                  *
00101                  * This method should be the first one to be called during the lifetime of a Session
00102                  * object. Otherwise strange things may happen.
00103                  *
00104                  * @param headers The HTTP request headers, converted into CGI headers and encoded as
00105                  *                a string, according to the description.
00106                  * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>headers</tt>.
00107                  * @pre headers != NULL
00108                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00109                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00110                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00111                  */
00112                 virtual void sendHeaders(const char *headers, unsigned int size) {
00113                         TRACE_POINT();
00114                         int stream = getStream();
00115                         if (stream == -1) {
00116                                 throw IOException("Cannot write headers to the request handler "
00117                                         "because the writer stream has already been closed.");
00118                         }
00119                         try {
00120                                 MessageChannel(stream).writeScalar(headers, size);
00121                         } catch (SystemException &e) {
00122                                 e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while writing headers "
00123                                         "to the request handler");
00124                                 throw;
00125                         }
00126                 }
00127                 
00128                 /**
00129                  * Convenience shortcut for sendHeaders(const char *, unsigned int)
00130                  * @param headers
00131                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00132                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00133                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00134                  */
00135                 virtual void sendHeaders(const string &headers) {
00136                         sendHeaders(headers.c_str(), headers.size());
00137                 }
00138                 
00139                 /**
00140                  * Send a chunk of HTTP request body data to the application.
00141                  * You can call this method as many times as is required to transfer
00142                  * the entire HTTP request body.
00143                  *
00144                  * This method should only be called after a sendHeaders(). Otherwise
00145                  * strange things may happen.
00146                  *
00147                  * @param block A block of HTTP request body data to send.
00148                  * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>block</tt>.
00149                  * @throws IOException The writer channel has already been closed.
00150                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00151                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00152                  */
00153                 virtual void sendBodyBlock(const char *block, unsigned int size) {
00154                         TRACE_POINT();
00155                         int stream = getStream();
00156                         if (stream == -1) {
00157                                 throw IOException("Cannot write request body block to the "
00158                                         "request handler because the writer stream has "
00159                                         "already been closed.");
00160                         }
00161                         try {
00162                                 MessageChannel(stream).writeRaw(block, size);
00163                         } catch (SystemException &e) {
00164                                 e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while sending the "
00165                                         "request body to the request handler");
00166                                 throw;
00167                         }
00168                 }
00169                 
00170                 /**
00171                  * Get the I/O stream's file descriptor. This steam is full-duplex,
00172                  * and will be automatically closed upon Session's destruction,
00173                  * unless discardStream() is called.
00174                  *
00175                  * @pre The stream has not been fully closed.
00176                  */
00177                 virtual int getStream() const = 0;
00178                 
00179                 /**
00180                  * Set the timeout value for reading data from the I/O stream.
00181                  * If no data can be read within the timeout period, then the
00182                  * read call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00183                  *
00184                  * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00185                  *             there will be no timeout.
00186                  * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00187                  */
00188                 virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00189                 
00190                 /**
00191                  * Set the timeout value for writing data from the I/O stream.
00192                  * If no data can be written within the timeout period, then the
00193                  * write call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00194                  *
00195                  * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00196                  *             there will be no timeout.
00197                  * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00198                  */
00199                 virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00200                 
00201                 /**
00202                  * Indicate that we don't want to read data anymore from the I/O stream.
00203                  * Calling this method after closeStream() is called will have no effect.
00204                  *
00205                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00206                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00207                  */
00208                 virtual void shutdownReader() = 0;
00209                 
00210                 /**
00211                  * Indicate that we don't want to write data anymore to the I/O stream.
00212                  * Calling this method after closeStream() is called will have no effect.
00213                  *
00214                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00215                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00216                  */
00217                 virtual void shutdownWriter() = 0;
00218                 
00219                 /**
00220                  * Close the I/O stream.
00221                  *
00222                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00223                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00224                  */
00225                 virtual void closeStream() = 0;
00226                 
00227                 /**
00228                  * Discard the I/O stream's file descriptor, so that Session won't automatically
00229                  * closed it upon Session's destruction.
00230                  */
00231                 virtual void discardStream() = 0;
00232                 
00233                 /**
00234                  * Get the process ID of the application instance that belongs to this session.
00235                  */
00236                 virtual pid_t getPid() const = 0;
00237         };

00240         /**
00241          * A "standard" implementation of Session.
00242          */
00243         class StandardSession: public Session {
00244         protected:
00245                 function<void()> closeCallback;
00246                 int fd;
00247                 pid_t pid;
00248                 
00249         public:
00250                 StandardSession(pid_t pid,
00251                                 const function<void()> &closeCallback,
00252                                 int fd) {
00253                         this->pid = pid;
00254                         this->closeCallback = closeCallback;
00255                         this->fd = fd;
00256                 }
00257         
00258                 virtual ~StandardSession() {
00259                         TRACE_POINT();
00260                         closeStream();
00261                         closeCallback();
00262                 }
00263                 
00264                 virtual int getStream() const {
00265                         return fd;
00266                 }
00267                 
00268                 virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00269                         MessageChannel(fd).setReadTimeout(msec);
00270                 }
00271                 
00272                 virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00273                         MessageChannel(fd).setWriteTimeout(msec);
00274                 }
00275                 
00276                 virtual void shutdownReader() {
00277                         TRACE_POINT();
00278                         if (fd != -1) {
00279                                 int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_RD);
00280                                 if (ret == -1) {
00281                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the writer stream",
00282                                                 errno);
00283                                 }
00284                         }
00285                 }
00286                 
00287                 virtual void shutdownWriter() {
00288                         TRACE_POINT();
00289                         if (fd != -1) {
00290                                 int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_WR);
00291                                 if (ret == -1) {
00292                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the writer stream",
00293                                                 errno);
00294                                 }
00295                         }
00296                 }
00297                 
00298                 virtual void closeStream() {
00299                         TRACE_POINT();
00300                         if (fd != -1) {
00301                                 int ret = syscalls::close(fd);
00302                                 if (ret == -1) {
00303                                         throw SystemException("Cannot close the session stream",
00304                                                 errno);
00305                                 }
00306                                 fd = -1;
00307                         }
00308                 }
00309                 
00310                 virtual void discardStream() {
00311                         fd = -1;
00312                 }
00313                 
00314                 virtual pid_t getPid() const {
00315                         return pid;
00316                 }
00317         };

00325         SessionPtr connectToUnixServer(const function<void()> &closeCallback) const {
00326                 TRACE_POINT();
00327                 int fd, ret;
00328                 
00329                 do {
00330                         fd = socket(PF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00331                 } while (fd == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00332                 if (fd == -1) {
00333                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a new unconnected Unix socket", errno);
00334                 }
00335                 
00336                 struct sockaddr_un addr;
00337                 addr.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00338                 strncpy(addr.sun_path, listenSocketName.c_str(), sizeof(addr.sun_path));
00339                 addr.sun_path[sizeof(addr.sun_path) - 1] = '\0';
00340                 do {
00341                         ret = ::connect(fd, (const sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(addr));
00342                 } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00343                 if (ret == -1) {
00344                         int e = errno;
00345                         string message("Cannot connect to Unix socket '");
00346                         message.append(listenSocketName);
00347                         message.append("'");
00348                         do {
00349                                 ret = close(fd);
00350                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00351                         throw SystemException(message, e);
00352                 }
00353                 
00354                 return ptr(new StandardSession(pid, closeCallback, fd));
00355         }
00356         
00357         SessionPtr connectToTcpServer(const function<void()> &closeCallback) const {
00358                 TRACE_POINT();
00359                 int fd, ret;
00360                 vector<string> args;
00361                 
00362                 split(listenSocketName, ':', args);
00363                 if (args.size() != 2 || atoi(args[1]) == 0) {
00364                         throw IOException("Invalid TCP/IP address '" + listenSocketName + "'");
00365                 }
00366                 
00367                 struct addrinfo hints, *res;
00368                 
00369                 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
00370                 hints.ai_family = PF_INET;
00371                 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00372                 ret = getaddrinfo(args[0].c_str(), args[1].c_str(), &hints, &res);
00373                 if (ret != 0) {
00374                         int e = errno;
00375                         throw IOException("Cannot resolve address '" + listenSocketName +
00376                                 "': " + gai_strerror(e));
00377                 }
00378                 
00379                 do {
00380                         fd = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00381                 } while (fd == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00382                 if (fd == -1) {
00383                         freeaddrinfo(res);
00384                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a new unconnected TCP socket", errno);
00385                 }
00386                 
00387                 do {
00388                         ret = ::connect(fd, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen);
00389                 } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00390                 freeaddrinfo(res);
00391                 if (ret == -1) {
00392                         int e = errno;
00393                         string message("Cannot connect to TCP server '");
00394                         message.append(listenSocketName);
00395                         message.append("'");
00396                         do {
00397                                 ret = close(fd);
00398                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00399                         throw SystemException(message, e);
00400                 }
00401                 
00402                 return ptr(new StandardSession(pid, closeCallback, fd));
00403         }

00406         /**
00407          * Construct a new Application object.
00408          *
00409          * @param theAppRoot The application root of an application. In case of a Rails application,
00410          *             this is the folder that contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc.
00411          *             This must be a valid directory, but the path does not have to be absolute.
00412          * @param pid The process ID of this application instance.
00413          * @param listenSocketName The name of the listener socket of this application instance.
00414          * @param listenSocketType The type of the listener socket, e.g. "unix" for Unix
00415          *                         domain sockets.
00416          * @param ownerPipe The owner pipe of this application instance.
00417          * @post getAppRoot() == theAppRoot && getPid() == pid
00418          */
00419         Application(const string &theAppRoot, pid_t pid, const string &listenSocketName,
00420                     const string &listenSocketType, int ownerPipe) {
00421                 appRoot = theAppRoot;
00422                 this->pid = pid;
00423                 this->listenSocketName = listenSocketName;
00424                 this->listenSocketType = listenSocketType;
00425                 this->ownerPipe = ownerPipe;
00426                 P_TRACE(3, "Application " << this << ": created.");
00427         }
00428         
00429         virtual ~Application() {
00430                 TRACE_POINT();
00431                 int ret;
00432                 
00433                 if (ownerPipe != -1) {
00434                         do {
00435                                 ret = close(ownerPipe);
00436                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00437                 }
00438                 if (listenSocketType == "unix") {
00439                         do {
00440                                 ret = unlink(listenSocketName.c_str());
00441                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00442                 }
00443                 P_TRACE(3, "Application " << this << ": destroyed.");
00444         }

00451                 return appRoot;
00452         }

00455          * Returns the process ID of this application instance.

00461         /**
00462          * Connect to this application instance with the purpose of sending
00463          * a request to the application. Once connected, a new session will
00464          * be opened. This session represents the life time of a single
00465          * request/response pair, and can be used to send the request
00466          * data to the application instance, as well as receiving the response
00467          * data.
00468          *
00469          * The use of connect() is demonstrated in the following example.
00470          * @code
00471          *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00472          *   Application::SessionPtr session(app->connect("/home/webapps/foo"));
00473          *   
00474          *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00475          *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00476          *   session->sendBodyBlock(...);
00477          *   // Done sending data, so we close the writer channel.
00478          *   session->shutdownWriter();
00479          *
00480          *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00481          *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00482          *   // Done reading data, so we close the reader channel.
00483          *   session->shutdownReader();
00484          *
00485          *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00486          *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00487          *   session.reset();
00488          *
00489          *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00490          *   // the previous session is closed.
00491          *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00492          * @endcode
00493          *
00494          * Note that a RoR application instance can only process one
00495          * request at the same time, and thus only one session at the same time.
00496          * It's unspecified whether Rack applications can handle multiple simultanous sessions.
00497          *
00498          * You <b>must</b> close a session when you no longer need if. If you
00499          * call connect() without having properly closed a previous session,
00500          * you might cause a deadlock because the application instance may be
00501          * waiting for you to close the previous session.
00502          *
00503          * @return A smart pointer to a Session object, which represents the created session.
00504          * @param closeCallback A function which will be called when the session has been closed.
00505          * @post this->getSessions() == old->getSessions() + 1
00506          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00507          * @throws IOException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00508          */
00509         SessionPtr connect(const function<void()> &closeCallback) const {
00510                 TRACE_POINT();
00511                 if (listenSocketType == "unix") {
00512                         return connectToUnixServer(closeCallback);
00513                 } else if (listenSocketType == "tcp") {
00514                         return connectToTcpServer(closeCallback);
00515                 } else {
00516                         throw IOException("Unsupported socket type '" + listenSocketType + "'");
00517                 }
00518         }
00519 };
